pullRequest.title: [RW-4242][Risk=moderate] Remove common api
pullRequest.bodyText:
Description:
This removes the common api directory.
I want to move quickly on this because it could end up with a bunch of rebases if it sits too long.

PR checklist

 This PR meets the Acceptance Criteria in the JIRA story
 The JIRA story has been moved to Dev Review
 This PR includes appropriate unit tests
 I have run and tested this change locally
 If this includes an API change, I have updated the appropriate Swagger definitions and notified API consumers
 If this includes a new feature flag, I have created and linked new JIRA tickets to (a) turn on the feature flag and (b) remove it later

nodes.bodyText: The cbCriteriaDao seemed unused, so I removed it here.

Pls undo this change (& update IntelliJ settings to avoid star-imports... which reminds me, I'd still like to package a "AoU IntelliJ settings" file to make it easier for us to have a canonical set of configs we can all rely on)

This feels like it could potentially be a breaking change, depending on which of the conflicting enums "won out" in our resulting Swagger-codegen world. What gives you confidence that this is the correct resolution, using the all-caps variant?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -3329,11 +3584,7 @@ definitions:
 
   PrePackagedConceptSetEnum:
     type: string
-    enum:
-      - None
-      - Demographics
-      - Survey
-      - Both
+    enum: &PrePackagedConceptSetEnum [NONE, DEMOGRAPHICS, SURVEY, BOTH]
